name: 英文（三）：文學與文化
restrict: ◎必須先修過【英文(一)】◎必須先修過【英文(二)】
description: 閱讀文學及文化文本，欣賞並了解英語文多變的風貌與魅力；並透過英文聽說讀寫練習，認識與討論文學和文化議題。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

*   **Course Description:**

This course aims to help students reach higher-level English proficiency and develop their intercultural competence. Topics included in this course will mainly focus on Southeast Asian cultures, with a specific emphasis on Vietnamese and Indonesian cultures and traditions. Students will get to know the cultures of these two countries by participating in a variety of classroom activities, such as group work, lectures, and hands-on tasks.

*   **Course Objectives:**

This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation.

*   **Delivery of instruction:**

1.  Lecture
2.  Group discussion & cooperation
3.  Student presentation
4.  Group work

*   **Grading Policy & Course Requirements:**

**1.     Grading Policy:**

    (1) Attendance/participation: 20%

    (2) Assignment: 15%

    (3) Learner diary: 15%

    (4) Midterm progress report: 10%                                                                                                    

    (5) Cultural portfolio project: 40%

**2.    Course requirements**

Class attendance is a fundamental requirement that will be strictly enforced in this course. You are required to come to class every week. Absence from **each class period** will result in a 2.5-point deduction from the final course grade (except for a valid excuse approved by the instructor). Arriving late to class or leaving early will also count as an absence. Students’ participation will also be scored based on how much they contribute to discussions in class and during teacher-student conferences.

    **(2) Assignment (15%)**

    **(3) Learner Diary (15%)**

You need to submit **four diary entries** in this semester. Each entry has to be **no less than 250 words**.

You need to hand in an individual midterm progress report that details the progress of your group’s final project and your personal reflection on the progress.

    **(4) Final Project: Cultural Portfolio (40%):**

You will work in a small group to complete a cultural portfolio project. This project aims to help you become more familiar with a Southeast Asian culture. The instructor will help you develop your cultural portfolio step by step. At the end of this semester, every group needs to submit a portfolio and also give a presentation.

*   Individual oral presentation: 10%
*   Group portfolio: 20%
*   Personal reflection: 10%

*   Please note that you are required to submit any of your assignments (including reports and projects) on/before the due day. Late assignments will be marked down by 30%. Once they are two or more days late, they will NOT be accepted under any circumstances. 

*   **1/40 Story Platform (****四十分之一故事月台****)**

You are required to take part in the event, **1/40 Story Platform**, at least once in this semester. This event is hosted by One-Forty, a Taipei-based NGO devoted to facilitating cross-cultural interaction between migrant workers in Taiwan and local Taiwanese people (or non-migrant workers). From March to June, this event will take place in Taipei Main Station on **March 10 (Sunday)**, **April 14 (Sunday)**, **May 5 (Sunday)**, and **June 16 (Sunday)**, **from** **2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m**. Participants will share their stories and cultures with one another.

**3\. Textbook:**

There is no set textbook for this course. Reading materials will be provided.

**\*Special Note:**

Please note that students enrolled in this course will participate in various activities that are related to a research project on multicultural education in university English classrooms. Although students need to complete all of the activities as a requirement of this course, their rights and welfare will be carefully protected in this course.
